The injured have been shifted to hospital, police said. The victims had been returning from the Dattatreya temple in Ganagapur when the incident took place, police added.

347.title: IPL franchise Gujarat Titans to launch team jersey on Sunday
347.article_body: Gujarat Titans, who will make their debut in IPL 2022, announced that they will be hosting their inaugural event on Sunday in which they will be launching the team jersey. Gujarat Titans squad will have a pre-season camp at the Narendra Modi Stadium in Ahmedabad before the start of IPL 2022.

348.title: New govt in Manipur will be formed before March 19: CM
348.article_body: Outgoing Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Friday said that the new government in Manipur will be formed before March 19 when the current state assembly term ends. Singh has resigned from the post and has been asked to continue as caretaker CM by Governor La Ganesan. The BJP won 32 out of 60 Assembly seats in Manipur.

349.title: Bhopal prof, accused of sexually harassing girls, quits after ruckus
349.article_body: Professor Tapan R Mohanty of Bhopal's National Law Institute University resigned on Thursday amid allegations that he sent vulgar messages to female students. Several students had gheraoed his office demanding his resignation. "From the past two years, we conducted online classes so how can I harass them," Mohanty asked. MP CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan ordered an inquiry into the matter.

350.title: What is the Most Favoured Nation status that US, allies want to revoke for Russia?
350.article_body: The World Trade Organization's 164 members commit to treating each other equally in order to benefit from the lowest tariffs, few trade barriers, among other things. This principle of non-discrimination is known as the Most Favoured Nation (MFN) treatment. By revoking Russia’s MFN status, Western allies can levy whatever import tariffs, quotas on Russian goods or even ban them.

351.title: Huma prepped for Gangubai Kathiawadi song at night amid Maharani shoot
351.article_body: Actress Huma Qureshi, who made a special appearance in Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Gangubai Kathiawadi' in the song 'Shikayat', did the prepping and rehearsals for the song at night. She was busy during the day shooting for her web show 'Maharani' at the time. "I enjoyed the whole process and the vision Sanjay (Leela Bhansali) sir had for the song," Huma said.

352.title: Gave Shafali a break because she was out of form: Ramesh Powar
352.article_body: Ramesh Powar, coach of India women's cricket team, revealed the reason for dropping opening batter Shafali Verma in the World Cup match against New Zealand on Thursday. Powar said that Verma was "given a break since the opener was out of form". Left-handed batter Yastika Bhatia replaced her in the match, which India lost by 62 runs.

353.title: Direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3: Biden
353.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Friday said that "direct confrontation between NATO and Russia is World War 3". [It's] something we must strive to prevent," he added. "We'll defend every single inch of NATO territory. We'll not fight a war against Russia in Ukraine," said Biden. "Putin's war against Ukraine will never be a victory," he stated.

354.title: Russian shelling killed at least 1,582 in Ukraine's Mariupol: Report
354.article_body: City Council of Ukraine's Mariupol on Friday said at least 1,582 civilians were killed due to Russian shelling and a blockade which lasted for 12 days. This comes as several civilian facilities including a children's hospital were destroyed by Russian forces in Mariupol since Russia launched a full-scale invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

355.title: Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of Punjab's people: Kejriwal
355.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party National Convenor Arvind Kejriwal on Friday said that he's sure that Bhagwant Mann will fulfil every expectation of the people of Punjab as the CM of the state. Notably, Punjab CM-elect Bhagwant Mann met Kejriwal in Delhi today, a day after AAP won Assembly elections in Punjab. Mann will take oath as Punjab CM on March 16.

356.title: Chinese Premier Li Keqiang says he will step down next March
356.article_body: China's Premier Li Keqiang on Friday said that he plans to step down after his current term expires next March. Li is number two in the hierarchy of ruling Communist Party's Politburo Standing Committee. Reportedly, President Xi Jinping is expected to secure a precedent-breaking third term as party chief at a party meeting to elect leaders for next five years.

357.title: Can't wait for tomorrow: Kohli shares net session pics ahead of 2nd Test
357.article_body: Ahead of India's second and final Test against Sri Lanka, Virat Kohli took to Twitter to share a few pictures from his practice session in Bengaluru. "Back to Bengaluru. Can't wait for tomorrow," he captioned the pictures. The ex-India captain recently played in his 100th Test in Mohali. He has scored 8,007 runs in Tests so far.

358.title: SP leader Yogesh Verma who guarded EVM room using binoculars loses
358.article_body: Samajwadi Party leader Yogesh Verma, who was seen guarding an EVM room using binoculars, lost on Thursday from Hastinapur in UP. The seat was won by BJP's Dinesh by 7,312 votes. Notably, SP chief Akhilesh Yadav had levelled EVM tampering allegations and even said the machines were being transported without informing candidates. SP bagged 111 out of 403 Assembly seats.

359.title: Turkey moves its embassy from Kyiv to Chernivtsi: State media
359.article_body: Turkish Foreign Ministry spokesperson Tanju Bilgiç on Friday said Turkey has moved its embassy from Ukrainian capital Kyiv to Chernivtsi amid reports of a planned attack on the capital city by the Russian forces, reported state media. A country sharing maritime borders with Russia as well as Ukraine, Turkey was among the last countries to operate diplomatic missions in Ukraine.

360.title: US bans import of Russian vodka, seafood & diamond; downgrades Russia's trade status
360.article_body: US President Joe Biden announced on Friday that along with the European Union and the Group of Seven countries, the US will move to revoke "most favoured nation" trade status for Russia over its invasion of Ukraine. "We're also taking further steps, banning imports of goods from several signature sectors of Russian economy, including seafood, vodka and diamonds," he added.

361.title: Aaron Finch joins his 9th IPL team, replaces KKR's ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales
361.article_body: Australia limited-overs captain Aaron Finch has become the first cricketer to have been part of nine IPL teams. The 35-year-old has joined KKR for ₹1.5 crore as a replacement for their ₹1.5-crore buy Alex Hales, who has withdrawn from IPL 2022 due to bubble fatigue. Finch has played for RR, DC, PWI, SRH, MI, GL, PBKS and RCB in IPL.

362.title: Ukraine urges Israel to send military weapons and sanction Russia
362.article_body: Ukrainian ambassador to Israel, Yevgen Korniychuk on Friday urged Israel's government to enhance its support for Ukraine by sanctioning Russia and sending defence equipment. "What we expect from Israel at the moment... is to join the sanctions of their allies, including but not only the US and EU," he added. Kornyichuk also urged Israel to accept more refugees without limitations.

363.title: Plant 75 trees in each village to mark 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav': PM
363.article_body: PM Narendra Modi said that each village should create a small forest by planting 75 trees during 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsav' to mark 75 years of India's Independence. There should be at least 75 farmers in each village who adopt natural way of farming, he added. PM Modi made the comments during his address at Gujarat Panchayat Mahasammelan in Ahmedabad.

364.title: Pakistan inducts made-in-China J-10C fighter jets to counter India's Rafale jets
364.article_body: Pakistan has formally inducted China-made multirole J-10C fighter jets into its air force. "Unfortunately, efforts are being made to create an imbalance in the region and to address this, a big addition has been made today to our defence system," Imran Khan said. Last year, Pakistan's Interior Minister said the jets were acquired to "counter India's purchase of Rafale aircraft".

365.title: Russian forces have caused $100 billion in damage so far: Ukrainian official
365.article_body: The invading Russian forces have so far cost damage of at least $100 billion to infrastructure and other physical assets, said Oleg Ustenko, economic advisor to Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy. He added that the war has caused 50% of Ukrainian businesses to shut down completely, while the other half are operating well below their capacity.

366.title: 25-year-old man dies of alleged drug overdose in Punjab's Bathinda
366.article_body: A 25-year-old man died of an alleged drug overdose in Punjab’s Bathinda on Friday. The victim who worked in Rajasthan had allegedly arranged the drugs after returning to his village on Thursday, according to a Bhartiya Kisan Union-Ugrahan leader. The drug availability "is a serious challenge before the AAP government," the leader added while demanding immediate steps to control it.

367.title: Malinga named RR's fast bowling coach, Paddy Upton returns as 'Team Catalyst'
367.article_body: RR have appointed Lasith Malinga as their fast bowling coach ahead of IPL 2022. Malinga, who retired as a player in 2021, is the highest wicket-taker in IPL. "It's a wonderful feeling for me to return to IPL and an absolute honour to join RR," Malinga said. Further, Paddy Upton, who has worked for RR before, returns as 'Team Catalyst'.

368.title: 3 dead, 2 injured after truck hits parked vehicles on MP highway
368.article_body: Three people were killed and two injured after a truck collided with two parked vehicles, a tanker and a pick-up van, on Rewa-Prayagraj National Highway in Madhya Pradesh on Friday. The victims were pulled out of the vehicles with help of locals, police said. The injured were rushed to a hospital, while the bodies were sent for post-mortem, police added.

369.title: Jussie Smollett given 150 days in jail over staged hate crime case
369.article_body: Actor Jussie Smollett, who portrayed Jamal Lyon in drama series 'Empire', has been sentenced to 150 days in jail for staging a hate crime. Jussie had alleged that he was attacked by two men who yelled racist and homophobic slurs at him. He has also been ordered to pay $120,106 (₹91 lakh) in restitution and a $25,000 (₹19 lakh) fine.

370.title: Man hangs himself in TN after wife breaks phone suspecting affair
370.article_body: A 22-year-old man allegedly died by suicide in Chennai after his wife broke his mobile while accusing him of having an affair with a woman. His wife, who had returned after spending six months at her native place, found him constantly messaging and speaking on phone, which led to an altercation, police said. She later found him hanging from ceiling.

371.title: Japanese schools ban ponytails fearing they might 'sexually excite' boys
371.article_body: Japanese schools have banned female students from wearing their hair in ponytails because the nape of their necks could "sexually excite" male students. "They are worried boys will look at girls," said a former middle school teacher. This is the same reasoning applied by schools while enforcing the white-only underwear rule for students, the ex-teacher said.

372.title: Singer Millind Gaba to marry longtime girlfriend on April 16
372.article_body: Singer Millind Gaba has revealed that he will be marrying his girlfriend of four years social media influencer Pria Beniwal on April 16. The festivities will begin on April 11 with the couple's sagan ceremony. The wedding is expected to be a traditional ceremony with Punjabi rituals along with  Haryanvi Jat rituals.

373.title: When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things: GT's Gurkeerat
373.article_body: On getting opportunity to play for Gujarat Titans in IPL 2022, batter Gurkeerat Mann said he's excited as the franchise showed faith in him. "When a team picks you, they think about a lot of things," he added. Gurkeerat was picked by Gujarat Titans for ₹50 lakh in mega auction 2022. He last played an IPL game in 2020 edition.

374.title: 27% winning candidates in Uttarakhand declared criminal cases: ADR
374.article_body: As per a report published by the Association for Democratic Reforms (ADR), 27% of the 70 winning candidates in Uttarakhand Assembly polls have declared criminal cases against themselves. The report said 14% of winning candidates have declared serious criminal cases against themselves. Five of the 47 winning BJP candidates have reported serious criminal cases against themselves, the report showed.

375.title: Attack on Saudi oil refinery, Yemen's Houthis claim responsibility
375.article_body: Saudi Energy Ministry on Friday said an oil refinery in capital Riyadh was attacked by a drone on Thursday early morning causing no injuries. "The refinery's operations and supplies of petroleum and its derivatives were not affected," added the ministry. Meanwhile, Yemen's Houthi rebels claimed responsibility for the attack. Three dones were fired at the oil refinery, Houthi spokesperson said.

376.title: My mom tried to leave Kyiv but decided to stay back & help: Dar Gai
376.article_body: Ukrainian filmmaker Dar Gai has said her mother had tried to leave Kyiv at one point but decided to stay back and help volunteers amid the Russian invasion. She added her uncle is also helping people in bomb shelters. "The war in Ukraine has been happening for the last eight years but now people are talking about it," she said.

377.title: Over 2.5 million people fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began: UN
377.article_body: UN's International Organization for Migration (IOM) on Friday said over 2.5 million people have fled Ukraine since Russian invasion began on February 24. IOM spokesperson Paul Dillon said while over 1.5 million refugees escaped to Poland, the rest were third-country nationals. Meanwhile, UN said that it verified 516 civilian deaths and 908 injuries since the conflict started.

378.title: Putin fires 8 generals, is furious over losses in war: Report
378.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin has sacked 8 generals and is furious at his intelligence officials over Moscow's losses in war, Ukraine's Defence Secretary Oleksiy Danilov claimed. He was quoted as saying by a Ukrainian newspaper that Russia has changed its tactics. The Russians never thought that Ukraine "is so united", said Danilov, adding that the road ahead "won't be easy".

379.title: Impossible for Congress to survive without Gandhis: DK Shivakumar
379.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar on Friday said it is impossible for Congress to stay united and survive without the Gandhi family. "They are key for the unity of the Congress party," he said. He made the remarks after Congress lost all five Assembly polls, triggering conversations about an introspection. "We...will always stand with the Gandhi family," he added.

380.title: What are chemical weapons that US fears Russia will use against Ukraine?
380.article_body: US has warned Russia may use chemical weapons against Ukraine. They are chemicals used to cause intentional death or harm through toxic properties, Organisation for the Prohibition of Chemical Weapons stated. Munitions, devices and equipment designed to weaponise toxic chemicals are also chemical weapons. Type of chemical agents include choking agents, blister agents, blood agents, nerve agents.

381.title: I'll be 100% there: Warner on attending Shane Warne's state funeral
381.article_body: Australia opener David Warner said he'll be 100% there for legendary spinner Shane Warne's state funeral, set to take place on March 30th at Melbourne Cricket Ground (MCG). "It [news] still hasn't really sunk in. When we first found out, we thought it was a joke," he added. "It's definitely going to be extremely emotional for everyone," he further said.

382.title: Pregnant woman accused by Russia of faking injuries in Ukraine gives birth
382.article_body: A Ukrainian beauty blogger who was accused on Twitter by the Russian Embassy in the UK of faking her injuries after their bomb hit a maternity hospital has now given birth to a girl. Marianna Podgurskaya was pictured heavily pregnant with injuries to her face as she walked down a staircase while holding her belongings. Twitter had deleted Russia's tweets

383.title: BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate: Mamata
383.article_body: After BJP won Assembly polls in four states, West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee said the BJP's victory is not a true reflection of people's mandate. She said that if Congress wants then all anti-BJP parties can fight together in the 2024 General Elections. "Don't be aggressive for now, be positive...This winning will be a big loss for BJP," she added.

384.title: Court orders 'The Kashmir Files' not to show scenes on late squadron leader
384.article_body: A Jammu district court has passed an interim order restraining the makers of 'The Kashmir Files' from showing scenes depicting late Squadron Leader Ravi Khanna in the movie. This comes after his wife filed a suit alleging that the scenes showing him are factually incorrect and demeaning. The Vivek Agnihotri directorial is set to be released on March 11.

385.title: Byju Raveendran invests $400 million in BYJU'S as it raises $800 million
385.article_body: BYJU'S announced on Friday it has raised $800 million in a new funding round as the edtech startup prepares to file for an IPO. Its Co-founder and CEO Byju Raveendran has personally invested $400 million in the current round, which saw participation from Sumeru Ventures, Vitruvian Partners and BlackRock. BYJU'S is now valued at about $22 billion, as per reports.

386.title: He's Modi ji's son: J&K man thanks govt as son evacuated from Ukraine
386.article_body: A man from J&K thanked the Central government as his son was evacuated from war-torn Ukraine's Sumy and reached Delhi today under Operation Ganga. He said, "I want to say...it's [PM Narendra Modi ji's] son who has returned, not my son...We had no hopes given the circumstances in Sumy." "I'm thankful to...Government of India for evacuating my son," he added.

387.title: UP CM Adityanath tenders his resignation day after winning polls
387.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM and BJP leader Yogi Adityanath tendered his resignation to Governor Anandiben Patel on Friday. BJP won 255 of the total 403 seats in UP, becoming the first ruling party to return to power in the state in 37 years. Before tendering his resignation, Adityanath chaired the last cabinet meeting of his first tenure as UP CM.

388.title: No security reasons to leave: Indian embassy in guidelines for students in Russia
388.article_body: Amid the war in Ukraine, the Indian embassy in guidelines for Indian students in Russia said that there are currently "no security reasons for them to leave". It, however, said that there are certain disruptions in banking services in Russia and direct flight connectivity to India and students concerned over these aspects may consider returning to India.

389.title: Zverev knows he was wrong, he recognised that very early: Nadal
389.article_body: Reacting to Alexander Zverev's apology for lashing out at chair umpire in Acapulco last month, 21-time Grand Slam champion Rafael Nadal said the world number three knows that he was wrong. "He recognised that very early...that's a positive thing," he added. Zverev was disqualified at Mexican Open for hitting umpire's chair with his racket many times following a doubles defeat.

390.title: Stellar explosion pushed particles close to cosmic speed limit: Study
390.article_body: A study published on Thursday said a massive explosion in a white dwarf star called nova accelerated particles close to cosmic speed limit. Scientists said gamma rays which were obtained from the shockwave were pushed close to theoretical speed limit which is near to the speed of light. The team used High Energy Stereoscopic System (HESS) to observe the explosion.

391.title: Dog floods kitchen by turning on tap in UK house, causes damage worth ₹4 lakh
391.article_body: A dog, which learnt how to turn on a kitchen tap, flooded the room of his owners' house in the UK, while they were out, causing them damage worth £4,000 (around ₹4 lakh). The incident was caught on the house's security camera which showed the dog standing on its hind legs to reach the tap at the kitchen sink.

392.title: Russian space agency head bars employees from leaving country: Report
392.article_body: Dmitry Rogozin, Head of Russian space agency Roscosmos prohibited agency employees from travelling abroad in order to curb brain drain, reported Kamil Galeev, a Moscow-based journalist. This comes as skilled professionals from IT, engineering, and hard sciences are leaving en masse, Galeev added. Reportedly, border guards are instructed to stop IT engineers, specialists from leaving the country.

393.title: Tina Ambani shares pics from son Anmol Ambani's wedding featuring Bachchan family
393.article_body: Businessman Anil Ambani's wife Tina Ambani took to Instagram on Friday to share pictures from the wedding of their son Anmol Ambani to Khrisha Shah. "A new chapter begins for Anmol and Khrisha with blessings from friends and family - the wedding," she wrote in the caption of the post. One of the photos features Amitabh Bachchan and his family.

394.title: Ex-Financial Services Secretary Debasish Panda appointed IRDAI Chairman
394.article_body: The government on Friday appointed Debasish Panda as Chairman of Insurance Regulatory and Development Authority of India (IRDAI). The appointment comes nearly 11 months after the post fell vacant following the completion of Subhash Chandra Khuntia's term in May last year. Panda is a 1987-batch IAS officer of the Uttar Pradesh cadre who retired as Financial Services Secretary this year.

395.title: Jailed Putin critic Navalny calls for anti-war protests across Russia
395.article_body: Jailed Russian President Vladimir Putin's critic Alexey Navalny has called for more anti-war protests across Russia on Sunday. "Putin will most quickly be stopped by the people of Russia now if they oppose the war," Navalny said. Over 13,900 people have been detained at anti-war demonstrations in Russia since the start of the invasion, according to a protest monitoring group.

396.title: Putin's idea of blitzkrieg in Ukraine failed: Ex-Ukrainian Prez
396.article_body: Speaking on Russia's invasion of Ukraine, former Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko on Thursday said that Russian President Vladimir Putin "understands that his idea of blitzkrieg has failed". He claimed that Ukraine's military and the unity of the Ukrainian people had slowed the Russian advance. "Please get out from Ukrainian soil...Please stop killing Ukrainians," Poroshenko added.

397.title: Russian forces used cluster bombs in Ukraine: UN human rights office
397.article_body: Office of the UN High Commissioner for Human Rights (OHCHR) on Friday said they have received credible reports of Russian forces using cluster munitions in populated areas in Ukraine. The office added indiscriminate use of such weapons is prohibited under international law. On February 28, Ukraine's rights groups had accused Russia of using cluster bombs during attacks on Ukrainian cities.

398.title: Drone apparently flying from Ukraine crashes in Croatia, none injured
398.article_body: Croatian authorities on Friday said a drone that apparently flew from Ukrainian war zone crashed in Croatian capital, Zagreb, creating a loud blast but no injuries. As per Croatia's National Security Council, a "pilotless military aircraft" entered the country's airspace from neighbouring Hungary. Meanwhile, Zagreb Mayor Tomislav Tomašević said initial findings suggested that it was an accident.

399.title: Kamala Harris laughs when asked about Ukrainian refugee crisis, criticised
399.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris, while addressing a press conference with Polish President Andrzej Duda, was asked by a journalist if the US was willing to make a "specific allocation for Ukrainian refugees". Harris broke into laughter before saying, "A friend in need is a friend indeed." The clip was widely circulated online with many criticising Harris for laughing.

400.title: Congrats erstwhile Lok Sabha benchmate Bhagwant: Tharoor on AAP's win
400.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor congratulated AAP leader Bhagwant Mann, who shared a bench with him in Lok Sabha, for winning Punjab. "Two pulmonologists and four eye surgeons among 13 doctors who are now AAP MLAs, the highest ever...Let's wish them luck," he tweeted. He also congratulated BJP for winning four states and added that Congress' convictions and values will prevail.

401.title: CEO rejects $100 mn offer for CB Insights, says 'never reply to Twitter DMs'
401.article_body: CB Insights' Indian-American CEO Anand Sanwal revealed he has declined a $100 million offer to acquire his market intelligence platform. Sharing screenshots of his conversation with the potential buyer, Sanwal tweeted, "A great reminder to never check or respond to Twitter DMs again." "You just missed the opportunity of a lifetime," the buyer told Sanwal after he rejected their offer.

402.title: It's like home venue for Kohli: Nikhil on pink-ball Test in Bengaluru
402.article_body: Referring to upcoming India-Sri Lanka pink-ball Test in Bengaluru, ex-India cricketer Nikhil Chopra said M Chinnaswamy Stadium is like a "home venue" for Virat Kohli as he has represented RCB many times here. "He has played more here in comparison to Delhi, [from] where he belongs. The way he's batting...can see him scoring that hundred pretty soon," he added.
